title: Ghostwork Uprising
outcome: Vanished citizens resurface, taking quiet control of critical city systems and leveraging this to demand restored rights and sweeping Council reforms. Citizens must choose sides as daily life is disrupted but violence is avoided.

events.description: Citizens notice city transit and resource distributions functioning despite BCI inconsistencies. Anonymous messages claim 'invisibles' are ensuring essential services.
'Ghosts' release a statement on every city terminal: Reintegrate all erased citizens and reform the Council, or expect organized infrastructure slowdowns—not sabotage, but strategic delays.

Daily commutes, deliveries, and power grid access fluctuate unpredictably. The public grows divided: some resent the invisible hand; others rally in support, marking windows and neighborhoods with white banners.
Council security quietly attempts to seize key system hubs but meets only empty stations and tampered records. The system’s vulnerabilities and the scope of the ghost network become clear.

A mass march of supporters—visible and invisible—demands full restoration of citizenship rights and direct talks with the Council. The city faces a defining choice between negotiated reform and a deepening stalemate.
